meanings.sent1: The tiny puppy was atremble with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The leaves on the tree were atremble in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The atremble squirrel tried to hold a tiny acorn.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was atremble with emotion as she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The atremble ground warned of an impending earthquake.

meanings.definition: In a state of trembling or quivering
meanings.sent1: The atremble flower petals danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The atremble rabbit cautiously peeked out of its burrow.
meanings.sent3: The atremble jelly on the plate made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: His atremble hands betrayed his nervousness during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The atremble candle flame flickered in the dark room.
